p: For COVID-19, it is more logical to find phytomedicinal agents that specifically target the interaction of RBD at the Spike/ACE2 complex and not particular to ACE2. This caution is because agents solely targeting ACE2 may interfere with ACE2 enzyme activity and its complex protective functions ( Kai and Kai, 2020). Natural products with significant RBD binding affinity compared to ACE2 can dominate over ACE2 in latching onto RBD, thereby blocking viral attachment, fusion and entry.
